member.name: T:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.Client.MeshMachine
member.summary: Describes a set of registered profiles on a particular machine, usually the current machine.
The MeshSession is a MeshMachine bound to a particular portal which supports Mesh portal operations such as write to portal and read from portal.

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.Client.MeshMachine.CreateDevice(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Create a new device profile and register it to the current machine.
member.param: The device short identifier, if null, the UDF is used.
Device description, if null, defaults to 'unknown'
If true, the new profile will be made the default. If null, the new profile will become the default if there is no default specified already. Otherwise, the default is unchanged.
member.returns: Session for the newly created device profile.

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.Client.MeshMachine.GetDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Get a device profile.

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.Client.MeshMachine.GetDevice(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get or create a device profile registered to the current machine.
member.param: If true, create a new profile. Otherwise create a new profile if and only if DeviceUDF is null and no default profile is registered.
Specify the device profile by UDF fingerprint.
The identifier for device profile if created.
The device description for the device profile if created.
member.returns: A device session for the newly created profile.

member.summary: Request validation of a proposed portal account name. Note that reporting the account name as available neither commits the service to reserve the name for the user or even create an account for them at all.
member.param: The Mesh Client to use (if available)
member.returns: The validation response message returned by the service.

The device description to use if a new device profile is created.
